awd_titl_txt: Development of an Undergraduate Laboratory for the          Hydrologic Sciences at the University of Notre Dame
awd_abstract_narration: A unique field and laboratory facility for the study of surface                 and subsurface hydrogeology is being installed.  This facility                  will provide students with the opportunity to observe the short                 and long term components of the hydrologic cycle in relation to                 the behavior of atmospheric, surface water and groundwater                      environments.  Included among the capabilities of the facility                  are:  (1) the ability to drill, case and test groundwater                       boreholes, (2) use of a networked field portable computer system,               (3) completion and interpretation of borehole geophysical logging,              and (4) collection and interpretation of remote sensing images.                 The facility will provide significant educational opportunities                 for undergraduates enrolled in courses offered in civil                         engineering, earth sciences and pre-engineering.
org_div_long_name: Office of Emerging Frontiers in Research and Innovation (EFRI)
